headline: Keysight Introduces Isolated Probing Technology for Fast-Switching Power Device Testing
summary: SANTA ROSA, Calif., March 10, 2025--Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS) has developed an optically isolated differential probing family dedicated to enhancing efficiency and performance testing of fast-switching devices such as wide bandgap GaN and SiC semiconductors. The new voltage probes will be displayed at Applied Power Electronics Conference (APEC) 2025 in Keysight’s booth (#829) along with Keysight’s MXR B and HD3 series of oscilloscopes.

content.title: Keysight Introduces Isolated Probing Technology for Fast-Switching Power Device Testing
content.summary: SANTA ROSA, Calif., March 10, 2025--Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS) has developed an optically isolated differential probing family dedicated to enhancing efficiency and performance testing of fast-switching devices such as wide bandgap GaN and SiC semiconductors. The new voltage probes will be displayed at Applied Power Electronics Conference (APEC) 2025 in Keysight’s booth (#829) along with Keysight’s MXR B and HD3 series of oscilloscopes.

thumbnail.caption: Keysight’s isolated differential probes provide up to 100 dB greater common-mode rejection than standard differential probes. (Photo: Business Wire)
